events.title: William the Conqueror Invades England
events.description: William, Duke of Normandy, lands on the English coast, beginning the Norman Conquest of England.
events.significance: This invasion led to the Battle of Hastings and significant cultural and political changes in England.

events.title: Vasco Núñez de Balboa Reaches the Pacific Ocean
events.description: Spanish explorer Vasco Núñez de Balboa becomes the first European to see the Pacific Ocean from the New World, after crossing the Isthmus of Panama.
events.significance: This discovery opened the door for further exploration and expansion into the Pacific region.

events.title: Congress Passes Bill Creating the U.S. Department of Foreign Affairs
events.description: The United States Congress passes legislation establishing the Department of Foreign Affairs, which would later become the Department of State.
events.significance: Marked the formal organization of U.S. foreign policy and diplomatic relations.

events.title: Sequoia National Park Established
events.description: Sequoia National Park in California is established as the second national park in the United States, protecting giant sequoia trees.
events.significance: This was an early step in the conservation movement to protect natural landmarks and biodiversity in the U.S.

events.title: Spanish Civil War: Bombing of Guernica
events.description: Guernica, a Basque town in Spain, is bombed by German and Italian warplanes supporting Franco's forces.
events.significance: The attack became a symbol of the horrors of war, inspiring Picasso's famous painting and international condemnation.
